thread.title: Mary Kom: The First Indian Woman Boxer To Win Gold Medal In Asian Games, 2014
thread.title_full: Mary Kom: The First Indian Woman Boxer To Win Gold Medal In Asian Games, 2014

title: Mary Kom: The First Indian Woman Boxer To Win Gold Medal In Asian Games, 2014
text: 110 SHARES With a biopic to herself, Mary Kom is one of the most well-known sportswomen in the country. Fondly called Magnificent Mary, the 34 -year-old boxer, hailing from Manipur, is only female boxer to have won a medal in each of the six world championships. Not just this, she is also the only Indian female boxer to have qualified for the 2012 Summer Olympics. Ranked as No. 4 in AIBA World Women's Ranking Flyweight category, she went on to become the first Indian female boxer to get a gold medal in the 2014 Asian Games held in Incheon, South Korea. From being a small town girl, born to a farmers' family in Manipur, to becoming an award-winning (including the Padma Bhushan and Padma Shree) sportswoman, Mary's journey is nothing less than magnificent. And if this doesn't inspire you to fight for what you believe in, deliver your best, and break stereotypes, then maybe these quotes by her will:
